sectionA.a10: Year of Establishment of the School

a13.title: Number of students enrolled in the school

a14.title: Number of Children with Special Needs

sectionA.a16: Mention the star rating of awards obtained through SVP?
sectionA.a17: Has the school developed Swachhata Action Plan (SAP)?
sectionA.a18: Is the school aware of the requirements of the Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for Sustaining Water, Sanitation & Hygiene in schools (https://schooledn.py.gov.in/ssarmsa/pdf/SOP for WASH - 14-10-2021.pdf)?

sectionB1.b11: Whether the school has a school safety or equivalent committee?
sectionB1.b12: If yes in question 1.1, Is there a clear list of committee members available with the school?
sectionB1.b13: Are any of the school cabinet members part of the School safety committee?
sectionB1.b14: Whether school has developed School Safety Plan (SSP) or equivalent?
sectionB1.b15: Whether the School's safety Plan have components of WASH ?
sectionB1.b16: If school has identified the disaster hazards?
sectionB1.b17: were children actively involved in identifying  hazards in the school?
sectionB1.b18: Is your school vulnerable to any natural disasters ?
sectionB1.b19: what are the likely climate-related events/ natural hazards/ other risks, and their intensity  (State/ district may like to further add  rows and points to the lists, with few lines left to be filled by the school concerned)
sectionB1.b110: Has school done identified the impact of the above disasters on the WASH infrastructure in schools ?
sectionB1.b111: Is the school located near any potential risk zone ?
sectionB1.b112: Does your school have a practice of conducting mock drills for disaster response?
sectionB1.b113: Whether the WASH facilities in Schools are able to be effective during  drought, floods, cyclones, forest fire, landslide, etc.?

sectionB2.b21: What is the main source of water supply in your school?
sectionB2.b22: Is adequate safe drinking water (at least 1.5 litre per child per day in non-residential & 5 litre per child per day in residential school) available from this water supply, all days throughout the year?
sectionB2.b23: How is drinking water stored and handled in the school?
sectionB2.b24: Does the water stored in the school adequate to meet the requirement of water for all purposes?
sectionB2.b25: Is the quality of drinking water tested
sectionB2.b26: Whether testing reports available with the school?
sectionB2.b27: How many functional drinking water points are there in the school?
sectionB2.b28: Do all the drinking water points have proper platforms/ floor and safe drainage arrangements?
sectionB2.b29: Are all water sources of the school secured during the flood situation/cyclone ?
sectionB2.b210: What is the main source of water for use in toilets?
sectionB2.b211: What is the main source of water used for hand washing before Mid-Day Meal (MDM) / lunch by students and cooks?
sectionB2.b212: Is there a functional Rainwater Water Harvesting facility in the school ?
sectionB2.b213: Does the school have adopted any of the following water use reduction strategies?
sectionB2.b214: Are the school premises free of water logging?
sectionB2.b215: School has awareness programme on water conservation in the community ?

sectionB3.b31: Does the school have separate toilets for boys and girls in working condition?

b32.title: How many toilets seats in working condition does the school have for boys and girls? (column may have state/ regional specific customization considering the likely climate event/ natural hazard)

b33.title: How many urinals in working condition does the school have for boys and girls?

sectionB3.b34: Does the school have toilets accessible to the Children with Special Needs (CWSN) (an accessible toilet for CWSN, is one that if there is a functional toilet with ramp, handrail, and wide door for wheelchair entry inside toilet)?
sectionB3.b35: Do all the toilets in the school have secure door with latch and cloth hanging hooks?
sectionB3.b36: Does the school's toilet have adequate ventilation for natural light and air?
sectionB3.b37: What is the frequency of cleaning toilets?
sectionB3.b38: Are toilets cleaned with appropriate cleaning material?
sectionB3.b39: Who supervises the cleaning and maintenance of the toilets in the school?
sectionB3.b310: Does the school do timely upkeeping/maintenance of fitting and fixtures of toilets?
sectionB3.b311: Are any toilets in the school prone to the impact of climate/natural hazards (as floods/ drought/seasonal water scarcity etc)?
sectionB3.b312: Does the school have separate dustbins with lid and with specific colours for disposal of menstrual waste?
sectionB3.b313: Which of the following option is used by the school for safe treatment/ disposal of sanitary waste?
sectionB3.b314: Does the school have scheduled desludging of the faecal matter (preferably before monsoon), in coordination with nearby service provider?

sectionB4.b41: Does the school have a facility for hand-washing before Mid-Day Meal (MDM) / lunch where a group of children can practice hand washing at the same time?
sectionB4.b42: Does the school provide soaps/ liquid handwash for handwashing before Mid-Day Meal (MDM) / lunch?
sectionB4.b43: Does the school have facility for hand-washing after the use of the toilet?
sectionB4.b44: Does the school provide soaps for hand washing/liquid soap after use of toilets?
sectionB4.b45: Is the height of hand-washing facilities suitable for children of all age groups in the school?
sectionB4.b46: Does the school have a proper mechanism for wastewater disposal near all the hand washing unit?
sectionB4.b47: Who supervises the practice of daily hand-washing with soap by students and cooks before Mid-Day Meal (MDM) / lunch?
sectionB4.b48: Do all children wash their hands with soap before mid-day meal (MDM)/ Lunch?

sectionB5.b51: Has your school adopted the 5R's (refuse, reduce, reuse, repurpose, and then recycle) of waste management Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)?
sectionB5.b52: Does the school provide dustbins in each classroom, kitchen area, toilet, and other appropriate locations for the collection of waste? (Multiple responses may be there)
sectionB5.b53: Does the school segregate wet waste (bio-degradable waste) and dry waste (non-biodegradable waste)?
sectionB5.b54: How does the school compost its own biodegradable waste (wet waste)?
sectionB5.b55: How does the school dispose of its non-biodegradable waste (dry waste)?
sectionB5.b56: Is the school premises clean (free from littering)?
sectionB5.b57: Are the waste pits in your school secured from climate events such as floods (above the  the flood level/ have some kind of flood proofing arrangement) ?
sectionB5.b58: Has the school taken any innovative measures for the reuse of waste material (such as using plastic bottles and toffee wrappers for making bricks for fencing of vegetation/plants)
sectionB5.b59: Has school taken any measures to reduce, minimize or ban the use of single-use plastic?

sectionB6.b61: Has your school taken significant steps to maximize the usage of natural lighting throughout the building?
sectionB6.b62: Does your school generate/use energy from any of the renewable sources, such as
sectionB6.b63: Is there usage of LPG gas or other cleaner fuel sources for MDM ?
sectionB6.b64: Whether school use energy-efficient cookware, such as stove pressure cookers and/ or solar cookers?

sectionB7.b71: Whether the school premises are majorly covered with greeneries?
sectionB7.b72: Does the plantation of the species selected in the school are appropriate to the soil type, climatic condition and topography?
sectionB7.b73: Does the school maintain a plant diversity ?
sectionB7.b74: Does the school engage students in creative/ innovative ways in protecting, caring, and adopting plants/vegetation, including green fencing, etc.?

sectionB8.b81: Does the school have a boundary wall with secured gates ?
sectionB8.b82: Does the school have a system for regular monitoring (e.g., through checklists or observation) of the cleaning of WASH facilities?
sectionB8.b83: Does the school have access to adequate cleaning equipment (broom, shovels, mop, bucket etc)?'
sectionB8.b84: Who supervises the cleaning and maintenance of the toilets in the school?
sectionB8.b85: Is there an arrangement for any part/full-time cleaning/sanitation worker in the school?
sectionB8.b86: Do the Gram Panchayats (GPs)/Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) take an active part in reviewing and addressing school WASH and O&M issues?

sectionB9.b91: Does the school have at least 2 teachers trained in “climate resilient WASH services” ?
sectionB9.b92: Are the GP/ULB members imparted with orientation/ training on climate resilient WinS?
sectionB9.b93: Whether any student-led bodies/ group are there in schools to focus on  “climate resilient WASH services”?
sectionB9.b94: Is menstrual health management regularly discussed with or taught to students of appropriate age (at least once in 3 months)?
sectionB9.b95: Do students in the school are engaged in a Nature walk to explore, appreciate and learn the value of environmental conservation and biodiversity?
sectionB9.b96: Has the school taken any community outreach activities on climate-resilient WASH services in schools/ local settings?
sectionB9.b97: Does the school conduct cultural programs and competitions (essay, painting, debate) on Climate resilient water, sanitation, hygiene services?
sectionB9.b98: Does the school display and use climate resilient water, Sanitation and Hygiene related posters and materials for promoting environmental and hygiene education?
sectionB9.b99: Does the school observe special days/ fortnights actively- such as World Env. Day, Earth Day, World Water Day, World Toilet Day/GHD/ World Hand Hygiene/ Swachhata Pakhwada?

section1.a11: Whether the school has a school safety or equivalent committee?
section1.a12: Are any of the school cabinet members part of the School safety committee?
section1.a13: Whether school has developed School Safety Plan (SSP) or equivalent and WASH is included ?
section1.a14: Is your school vulnerable to any natural disasters ?
section1.a15: Has school done identified the impact of the above disasters on the WASH infrastructure in schools ?
section1.a16: Does your school have a practice of conducting mock drills for disaster response?
section1.a17: Is the Swachata action plan effective during  cyclone, heatwave, cold wave, floods, etc.?
section1.a18: Whether the WASH facilities in Schools are able to be effective during  drought, floods, cyclones, forest fire, landslide, etc

section2.a11: Main source of drinking water in the school - Treated running water with water storage tank within the school premises
section2.a12: Quantity of water available in the school for drinking - (at least 1.5 litter per child per day in non-residential & 5 litter per child per day in residential schools), a buffer of 2 days
section2.a13: Drinking water stored in the school - Container/pitcher with lid and ladle, Container with taps
section2.a14: Drinking water treated regularly in school. (Boiling, Adding chlorine/ Bleaching powder (Chlorination), Filtration, Solar disinfection, Advanced treatment unit (RO, UV, micro-filtration, etc.)
section2.a15: Quality of drinking water tested - Tested twice in a year
section2.a16: Number of functional drinking water point in the schools (1 per 20 students)
section2.a17: Main source of water for use in toilets - Continuous water supply through taps inside each toilet unit
section2.a18: Main source of water for hand-washing after using toilets - Running water with taps at all the hand washing points
section2.a19: Main source of water for hand washing before Mid-Day Meal (MDM) / lunch by students and cooks - Running water with taps at all the hand washing points
section2.a110: Functional rain water harvesting facility in the school
section2.a111: If school has a storage structure/ tank for the RWH? What is the capacity in litres?
section2.a112: Whether the school use rainwater for drinking water and other purposes (wherever applicable)?
section2.a113: How frequently school does thorough sanitary inspections of the water source (including water points) in the school?
section2.a114: Does the school have adopted any of the following water use reduction strategies?
section2.a115: Does the school have a robust mechanism of frequent monitoring and instant repair leakage and wastage of water?
section2.a116: Is the school (including campus, building, classrooms, etc.) located above the flood levels?
section2.a117: Are the school premises free of water logging?
section2.a118: Which among the following greywater (e.g. wastewater near a water source, from the kitchen, utensil washing, etc. ) management system/infrastructure (including treatment) is/ are adopted in the school?
section2.a119: Has the school done a water budgeting exercise with the students of the appropriate age, last year?
section2.a120: Has the school conducted local awareness drives on water conservation and management drive in the community/ locality?

section3.a11: School has separate toilet units (1 toilet seat and 3 urinals) in working condition for boys and girls - there is at least one toilet unit each for boys and girls.
section3.a12: How many toilets seats in working condition does the school have for boys and girls: Boys
section3.a13: How many toilets seats in working condition does the school have for boys and girls: Girls
section3.a14: How many urinals does the school have for boys and girls: Boys
section3.a15: How many urinals does the school have for boys and girls: Girls
section3.a16: School has toilets for Children with Special Needs (CWSN) - The school has at least one separate toilet for CWSN with ramp, handrail, wide door for wheelchair entry and support structure inside toilet.
section3.a17: The height and size of toilet and urinal facilities suitable for children of all age groups in the school
section3.a18: What are the most common type of toilet used by the students at the school?
section3.a19: School has separate toilets for Teachers and Staff - Teachers and staff use the toilets meant for students
section3.a110: All the toilets in the school have secure door with latch and cloth hanging hooks - Door with latch/bolt and cloth hanging hooks.
section3.a111: The toilets have roof and.  proper ventilation for natural light and air
section3.a112: School has separate dustbins with lid for disposal of sanitary waste?
section3.a113: Which of the option is used by the school for safe treatment/ disposal for of sanitary waste? (Electric Incinerator, is one of the options that functions at high temperature, and environmentally safe)
section3.a114: What is the main mechanism for disposal of toilet waste / faecal sludge
section3.a115: Are any toilets in the school prone to the impact of climate/natural hazards (as floods/ drought/seasonal water scarcity etc)?
section3.a116: Has the school taken appropriate measures to ensure disaster-resilient toilets in view of the local hazard/disaster vulnerability context
section3.a117: Does the school have scheduled desludging of the faecal matter (preferably before monsoon), in coordination with nearby service provider?

section4.a11: School has facility for handwashing after use of toilet - Wash basin for hand washing either inside or attached to every toilet unit
section4.a12: School provide soaps for hand washing after use of toilets - Soaps are available at all the hand washing points all the time
section4.a13: School has facility for handwashing before Mid-Day Meal (MDM) / lunch where a group of children can practice hand washing at the same time - Yes, with water from taps
section4.a14: School provide soaps for handwashing before Mid-Day Meal (MDM) / lunch - Soaps are available at all the handwashing points at all the times
section4.a15: All children wash their hands with soap before mid-day meal (MDM)/ Lunch - All children wash their hands with soap
section4.a16: Is the height of handwashing facilities suitable for children of all age groups in the school
section4.a17: Does the school have a proper mechanism for wastewater disposal near all the hand washing unit?
section4.a18: Does the school have developed some kind of recording system of daily handwashing with soap before the mid-day meal?

section5.a11: School provide dustbins in each class room, kitchen area, toilets and at other appropriate locations for collection of waste
section5.a12: Does the school segregate wet waste (bio-degradable waste) and dry waste (non- biodegradable waste)?
section5.a13: How does the school compost its own biodegradable waste (wet waste)? (Yes in school premises)
section5.a14: How does the school dispose its, non- biodegradable waste
section5.a15: Is the school premises clean (free from littering)?
section5.a16: School premises clean and free of water logging
section5.a17: School have containers for keeping the food grains safe (free from rodents)

section6.a11: The classrooms and teaching areas cleaned daily
section6.a12: The frequency of cleaning toilets – Daily
section6.a13: Toilets cleaned with appropriate cleaning material - Cleaned daily with soaping agent and disinfectant
section6.a14: Who supervises the cleaning and maintenance of the toilets in the school?
section6.a15: Whether school takes up the upkeep/maintenance of fitting and fixture of toilets etc on regular basis
section6.a16: School Management Committee take active part in reviewing and addressing school WASH & O&M
section6.a17: Does the Gram Panchayat looks after water, sanitation facilities in schools& school receive any funds from Gram for the  operation & maintenance (O&M) of this facilities?
section6.a18: Has school taken any measures to reduce, minimize or ban the use of single-use plastic?
section6.a19: Has your school adopted the 5R's (refuse, reduce, reuse, repurpose, and then recycle) of waste management Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)?
section6.a110: Has the school taken any innovative measures for the reuse of waste material (such as using plastic bottles and toffee wrappers for making bricks for fencing of vegetation/plants)
section6.a111: Has school engaged children in understanding the waste management priority through activities such as waste audit, waste trails, waste journey, etc?
section6.a112: Whether school has been able to mobilize adequate resources for the climate-resilient school interventions?
section6.a113: Does the school' maintain adequate supplies (e.g., chlorine, portable water quality testing equipment etc.) for any emergency preparedness and response?

section7.a11: Has the school developed it's own school-level strategies/ standard operating procedures (SOP) for reducing energy consumption?
section7.a12: Has your school taken significant steps to maximize the usage of natural lighting throughout the building?
section7.a13: Does your school generate/use energy from any of the renewable sources
section7.a14: Whether school use energy-efficient cookware, such as stove pressure cookers and/ or solar cookers?
section7.a15: Has your school undertaken any assessment of electricity consumption in school?

section8.a11: Does the plantation of the species selected in the school are appropriate to the soil type, climatic condition and topography?
section8.a12: Has the school planted   24 hour oxygen-generating plants/trees such as Banyan, Peepal, Tulsi, Money plant, Aloe Vera, etc.?
section8.a13: Has the school taken up noteworthy steps towards reducing noise pollution, including creating silent zones within and nearby the school campus ?

section9.a11: School has at least 2 teachers trained in sanitation and hygiene education
section9.a12: School have a Child cabinet (Bal Sansad) that takes an active role in promoting sanitation and hygiene practices
section9.a13: Supervision of practice of daily handwashing with soap by students and cooks before Mid-Day Meal (MDM) / lunch - Dedicated team of teachers/staff members and child cabinet members
section9.a14: School take up safe hygiene and sanitation education including awareness on hand-washing during morning assembly and in school clubs
section9.a15: Menstrual health management discussed with girl students - At least once every month
section9.a16: School regularly conducts cultural programs and competitions (Essay, painting, debate) on hygiene and sanitation
section9.a17: School display and use Water, Sanitation and Hygiene related posters and materials for promoting hygiene education
section9.a18: Has the school taken any community outreach activities on climate-resilient WASH services in schools/ local settings?
section9.a19: Does the school display and use climate resilient water, Sanitation and Hygiene related posters and materials for promoting environmental and hygiene education?
section9.a110: Does the school observe special days/ fortnights actively- such as World Env. Day, Earth Day, World Water Day, World Toilet Day/GHD/ World Hand Hygiene/ Swachhata Pakhwada?
